stories.text:
It's out of control now

https://twitter.com/search?q=%20TAKE2021&src=typed_query&f=live

https://twitter.com/search?q=ELOPUMP&src=typed_query&f=live

Thee scammer apparently have access to unlimited number of hacked accounts from which to post from . Somehow after all these years and thousands of highly paid engineers, twitter is unable to prevent accounts from being hijacked.

It's going to get wore that is for sure. These people making too much money to stop and twitter does not care either. Unless it involves ransomware, law enforcement doesn't care either.
stories.title: Elon Musk Twitter Inundated with Scam Posts

stories.text:
Did a free version of Unix need to happen in the environment of the 1990s, and therefore, someone else would have made it without Torvalds?

Or did he make it happen?

Would we be using something else today? Maybe GNUHerd would have received much greater attention, or BeOS would have been open sourced?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is Linus Torvalds a Great Man of History?
